intro: Vigna angularis var. nipponensis, commonly known as Japanese cowpea, is a leguminous plant native to East Asia. It is characterized by its slender, angular pods that contain small, edible seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has compound leaves with three leaflets. It thrives in warm climates and is cultivated for both its seeds and ornamental value. The species is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, benefiting surrounding plants.
